==== lvl1 ============: Below are all words for priority level 1 (this string does not need to be translated)

clear_utterance: 清除當前說話 [[ Clear the current utterance
jump_to_current_home: 跳轉到當前的主控板 [[ Jump to the current home board
go_back_one_board: 回一板 [[ Go back one board

copy_sentence: 將句子框中的內容複製到剪貼板 [[ Copy what's in the sentence box to the clipboard
past_sentence: 將clipbooard的文本內容粘貼到句子框中 [[ Paste the text contents of the clipbooard to the sentence box

speak_louder: 大聲說出當前說話 [[ Speak the current utterance, louder
speak_quieter: 講出當前說話的聲音，安靜些 [[ Speak the current utterance, quieter

add_comparative: 添加“更多”或“ -er”（比較） [[ Add "more" or "-er" (comparative)
add_superlative: 添加“最大”或“ -est”（最高級） [[ Add "most" or "-est" (superlative)
ordinal: 將“ st”，“ nd”，“ th”等（第一，第二，第三）添加到數字（普通） [[ Add "st", "nd","th", etc. (1st, 2nd, 3rd) to a number (ordinal)
negate_the_word: 否定這個詞 [[ Negate the word
past_tense: 使動詞過去時 [[ Make the verb past tense
make_present_participle: 使動詞現在分詞 [[ Make the verb present participle
beep_sound: 內聯播放提示音 [[ Play a beep sound inline
current_calendar_date: 說出當前的日曆日期 [[ Speak the current calendar date
current_time: 說出當前時間 [[ Speak the current time
current_day: 說出星期幾 [[ Speak the current day of the week
yesterday_calendar_date: 說出昨天的日曆日期 [[ Speak yesterday's calendar date
yesterday_day: 說出昨天的星期幾 [[ Speak the day of the week for yesterday

battery_level: 說出當前的電池電量 [[ Speak the current battery level
set_volume: 設置設備音量（向上，向下或##） [[ Set the device volume (up, down, or ##)
random_dice_number: 播放骰子滾動聲音，然後說出一個從1到n的隨機數 [[ Play a dice rolling sound and then speak a random number from 1 to n
pick_random_number: 講一個從1到n的隨機數 [[ Speak a random number from 1 to n
random_spinner_number: 播放微調聲音，然後說出一個從1到n的隨機數 [[ Play a spinner sound and then speak a random number from 1 to n

login_required: 用戶名和密碼都是必需的 [[ Username and password are both required
star_this_board: 像這個板子 [[ Like this board

headset_or_earpiece: 在耳機或聽筒上播放 [[ Play on Headset or Earpiece
earpiece: 在聽筒上播放 [[ Play on Earpiece
dont_stretch: 不要拉伸按鈕 [[ Don't Stretch Buttons

messages_and_alerts: 消息和警報 [[ Messages and Alerts

no_messages_or_alerts_to_show: 沒有消息或警報顯示 [[ No messages or alerts to show
modify_and_repair_message: 修改和修復消息 [[ Modify and Repair Message
no_words_to_repair: 句子框中沒有可修改的文本。修復工具可讓您快速添加，刪除，移動或修改單詞，以在用戶當前的語音窗口內進行更改。 [[ There is no text in the sentence box to modify. The repairs tool lets you quickly add, delete, move or modify words to make changes within the user's current speech window.
no_phrases: 尚未保存任何短語。您可以通過點擊句子框下拉菜單中的“記住此”來保存短語。 [[ No phrases have been saved. You can save phrases by hitting "Remember This" in the sentence box dropdown.
every_voice_should_be_heard: 每個聲音都應該聽到 [[ Every voice should be heard
private_data_reminder: 請記住：所有董事會和報告都可能包含用戶數據，應保密，並應予以尊重。 [[ Remember: all boards and reports may contain user data, and should be kept private and treated with respect.
success: 成功！一瞬間... [[ Success! One Moment...
share_via_facebook: 通過Facebook分享 [[ Share via Facebook
share_via_twitter: 通過Twitter分享 [[ Share via Twitter
set_as_home_board: 設為本壘 [[ Set as Home Board
in_board_set: 在用戶板上 [[ in the user's board set
speak_as_me: 跟我說話 [[ speak as me
add_to_sidebar: 添加到側邊欄 [[ Add to Sidebar
not_signed_in: 尚未登入 [[ Not signed in
exit_speak_mode: 退出朗讀模式 [[ Exit Speak Mode
settings_etc: 設置，菜單等 [[ Settings, Menu, etc.
show_all_buttons: 顯示隱藏的按鈕 [[ Show Hidden Buttons
stay_on_board: 留在董事會 [[ Stay on this Board
did_you_know: 你知道嗎？ %app_name%現在可以作為 [[ Did you know? %app_name% is now available as a
communication_is_for_everyone: 溝通適合每個人。 %app_name% [[ Communication is for everyone. %app_name%
empowers_hearing: 使人們能夠表達自己的聲音。 [[ empowers people to make their voices heard.
coughdrop_lets_you: 有些人很難聽到-完全沒有自己的過錯。自閉症，腦癱，唐氏綜合症，安格曼綜合症和瑞特綜合症等殘障人士使許多人難以獨自交流。稱為增強和替代通信（AAC）的強大軟件可以填補空白，並使每個聲音都能聽到。 [[ Some people are hard to hear -- through no fault of their own. Disabilities like autism, cerebral palsy, Down syndrome, Angelman syndrome and Rett syndrome make it harder for many individuals to communicate on their own. Powerful software called Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) can fill the gaps and make every voice heard.
coughdrop_lets_you_2: 在%app_name%，我們致力於通過強大的開源技術來幫助那些有復雜溝通需求的人們發聲，該技術可以輕鬆適應個人並支持周圍的所有人，以幫助他們取得成功。 [[ At %app_name% we work to help bring out the voices of those with complex communication needs through powerful open-source technology that easily adapts to the individual and supports everyone around them trying to help them succeed.
more_download_options: 更多下載選項 [[ more download options
personalize_text: 跨多個設備的通信和訪問。隨著時間的推移，您的詞彙量將不斷增加，其簡單的界面將得到大量幫助和培訓的支持。 [[ communication and access across multiple devices. Grow your vocabulary over time with a simple interface backed up by lots of help and training.
offline_text: 借助雲中的備份功能，因此在出現故障時切換設備非常輕鬆。您還可以與其他人共享木板，並向他們開放許可以供任何人使用。 [[ with backup in the cloud so it's painless to switch devices if something breaks. You can also share boards with others and open-license them for anyone to use.
empower_the_team: 授權團隊 [[ Empower the team
insights_text: 報告可以幫助每個人改善。團隊可以為每個人進行協作和修改電路板，而不必拿走他們的設備。 [[ with reports that help everyone improve. Teams can collaborate and modify boards for each individual without having to take their device away.
pricing_per_communicator: %app_name%按通訊員計價，因此父母，理療師和老師都可以免費註冊，並在自己的設備上使用強大的報告和通訊功能，而無需花很多錢。 [[ %app_name% is priced per-communicator, so parents, therapists, and teachers can all sign up for free and use the powerful reporting and communication features on their own devices without breaking the bank.
whats_it_cost: 請參閱我們的定價詳細信息。 [[ see our pricing details.
see_how: 看看人們如何使用 [[ see how people are using
try_coughdrop: 自己嘗試 _ TR2A _ [[ Try %app_name_upper% for yourself
sign_up_for_free: 準備看更多嗎？立即註冊以開始使用！ [[ Ready to see more? Sign up now to get started!
allow_cookies: 將使用情況數據發送到%app_name%進行分析，錯誤跟踪和功能改進 [[ Send usage data to %app_name% for analytics, error tracking and feature improvements
see_exmaples: ...或查看一些公共共享的董事會 [[ ...or check out some publicly-shared boards
people_i_supervise: 我監督的人 [[ People I Supervise
no_goal_set: 沒有設定目標 [[ no goal set
set_a_goal: 設定一個目標 [[ set a goal
ready_to_try_coughdrop: 準備自己嘗試%app_name%嗎？每次註冊均可免費使用2個月，以查看應用程序是否適用於輪胎，無需信用卡！ [[ Ready to try %app_name% out for yourself? Every signup gets 2 months free to kick the tires and see if the app is going to work for them, no credit card required!
==== lvl2 ============: Below are all words for priority level 2 (this string does not need to be translated)
email_shares: 當我管理的人與我分享消息時給我發送電子郵件 [[ Email Me When People I Supervise Share a Message with Me
text_shares: 當我監管的人向我發送消息時給我發短信 [[ Text Me When People I Supervise Share a Message with Me
app_shares: 我監督的人與我分享消息時在應用中顯示 [[ Show In the App When People I Supervise Share a Message with Me
no_notifications: 不要通過電子郵件發送給我Communicator報告 [[ Don't Email Me Communicator Reports
weekly_notifications: 通過電子郵件發送給我Communicator每週報告 [[ Email Me Weekly Communicator Reports
bi_weekly_reports: 每兩週通過電子郵件發送給我Communicator報告 [[ Email Me Communicator Reports Every Two Weeks
monthly_reports: 通過電子郵件發送給我Communicator每月報告 [[ Email Me Monthly Communicator Reports
email_goal_completion: 完成目標或獲得徽章後給我發送電子郵件 [[ Email Me When Goals are Completed or Badges are Earned
dont_email_goal_completion: 完成目標或獲得徽章後不要通過電子郵件發送給我 [[ Don't Email Me When Goals are Completed or Badges are Earned
pointer_release: 我在哪裡釋放指針 [[ Where I Release My Pointer
pointer_start: 我第一次按的地方 [[ Where I First Press
tap_and_swipe_inflections: 點擊以選擇，滑動以進行變形 [[ Tap to Select, Swipe for Inflections
eye_gaze: 視線追踪 [[ Eye Gaze Tracking
mouse_dwell: 基於光標的駐留跟踪 [[ Cursor-Based Dwell Tracking
joystick_key_dwell: 遊戲桿/基於鍵的駐留跟踪 [[ Joystick/Key-Based Dwell Tracking
time_on_target: 通過查看/停留在目標上進行選擇 [[ Select by Looking/Dwelling on a Target
button_select: 通過按下開關或按鈕進行選擇 [[ Select by Hitting a Switch or Button
system_default_voice: 系統默認語音 [[ System Default Voice
prior_home: 先前的本壘板 [[ Prior Home Boards
javscript_info: 沒有相對現代的JavaScript引擎，甚至無法加載該頁面。 [[ This page wouldn't even load without a relatively-modern JavaScript engine.
local_storage_info: 使用localStorage代替cookie來記住用戶是否已經登錄，他們在哪個板上等。 [[ localStorage is used instead of cookies to remember whether a user is already logged in, what board they were on, etc.
speech_synthesis_info: 大多數現代的網絡瀏覽器都實現了語音合成引擎，該引擎可用於將文本轉換為語音。 [[ Most modern web browsers implement a Speech Synthesis engine that can be used to turn text into speech.
speech_synthesis_voices: 語音合成語音 [[ Speech Synthesis Voices
speech_synthesis_info2: 如果您的設備支持語音合成，則默認情況下應安裝一個或多個語音。有時，聲音可能會“丟失”並停止出現在設備上。 [[ If your device supports Speech Synthesis, it should have one or more voices installed by default. Sometimes voices can get "lost" and stop appearing on the device.
file_uploads_info: 並非所有瀏覽器都支持%app_name%使用的現代文件上傳功能。如果您的設備不支持，那麼大多數現代桌面瀏覽器都應該可以上傳。 [[ Not all browsers support the modern file uploading features that %app_name% uses. If your device doesn't, most modern desktop browsers should upload just fine.
file_storage_info: 設備和某些瀏覽器允許您存儲文件以供脫機使用。如果此功能不可用，則某些文件可以存儲在數據庫中，但是您可能會遇到存儲錯誤。 [[ Devices and some browsers allow you to store files for offline use. If this feature is not available, some files can be stored in the database but you may run into storage errors.
indexed_db_info: IndexedDB是用於下載電路板和電路板內容的存儲工具，因此即使沒有Internet連接，%app_name%仍然可以工作。如果設備的內存已滿，有時這些數據庫將被自動（並且意外地）刪除。 [[ IndexedDB is a storage tool used to download boards and board contents so that %app_name% can still work even without an Internet connection. If the device's memory gets full sometimes these databases will be automatically (and unexpectedly) deleted.
sqlite_info: SQLite是另一個用於下載電路板和電路板內容的存儲工具，因此即使沒有Internet連接，%app_name%仍然可以工作。 SQLite數據庫在許多設備上均不可用，但未經許可不會被刪除。 [[ SQLite is another storage tool used to download boards and board contents so that %app_name% can still work even without an Internet connection. SQLite databases aren't available on as many devices, but won't get deleted without permission.
media_recording_info: 媒體錄製允許您使用設備的網絡攝像頭拍照和錄製音頻。某些移動設備使用自己的內置媒體錄製工具，而不是%app_name%的錄製器。 [[ Media Recording allows you to take pictures and record audio using your device's webcam. Some mobile devices use their own built-in media recording tools instead of %app_name%'s recorders.
xhr_cors_info: 為了脫機工作，%app_name%需要從多個網站下載圖像。 XHR / CORS不需要此功能，但是它使下載過程更有效。 [[ In order to work offline, %app_name% needs to download images from multiple web sites. XHR/CORS is not required for this to work, but it makes the download process more efficient.
canvas_info: %app_name%使您可以對圖像進行裁剪和著色以更好地滿足您的電路板要求，並且使用稱為Canvas的元素來實現此目的。 [[ %app_name% lets you crop and colorize images to better match your board requirements, and it uses something called the Canvas element to make that happen.
audio_playback_info: 如果您錄製自己的聲音，則希望能夠播放它們，但是並非所有瀏覽器都支持音頻播放，或者並非總是支持%app_name%使用的文件類型。 [[ If you record your own sounds you'll want to be able to play them back, but not all browsers support audio playback, or don't always support the file types %app_name% uses.
drag_and_drop_info: 在移動設備上這沒有意義，但是在桌面瀏覽器上，在編輯時將圖像和聲音拖放到按鈕上可以節省大量時間。 [[ It doesn't make sense on a mobile device, but on a desktop browser dragging and dropping images and sounds onto buttons while editing can save a lot of time.
file_reader_info: 如果您要從計算機上傳圖像或音頻以在CoughDrop中使用，則FileReader工具是必需的組件。 [[ The FileReader tool is a required component if you're uploading images or audio from your computer to use in CoughDrop.
geolocation_info: %app_name%可以選擇使用地理位置來跟踪使用情況並生成可以比較多個位置的通信的報告。 [[ %app_name% optionally uses geolocation to track usage and build reports that can compare communication across multiple locations.
speech_to_text: 語音轉文字 [[ Speech to Text
speech_to_text_info: 某些瀏覽器允許您講話，並將您的單詞轉換為文本。這樣可以更輕鬆地進行操作，例如創建要添加到新創建的板上的按鈕列表。 [[ Some browsers allow you speak and have your words converted to text. This can make it easier to do things like make a list of buttons to add to a newly-created board.
online: 在線/離線狀態 [[ Online/Offline Status
online_info: 一些瀏覽器允許檢查在線/離線狀態。 %app_name%可以使用它來更有效地脫機運行，並在重新建立Internet連接時自動同步更改和日誌。 [[ Some browsers allow checking for online/offline status. %app_name% can use this to function more effectively offline, and to automatically sync changes and logs when an Internet connection is re-established.
wakelock_info: 某些移動設備允許%app_name%防止由於不活動而關閉屏幕。 ％app_name％僅在處於“講話”模式或正在主動同步板時使屏幕保持打開狀態。 [[ Some mobile devices allow %app_name% to prevent the screen from turning off due to inactivity. %app_name% only keeps the screen on when in Speak Mode or when actively syncing boards.
fullscreen: 全屏模式 [[ Full Screen Mode
fullscreen_info: 在某些設備上，%app_name%可以在“朗讀模式”下激活全屏模式，以隱藏視圖中的所有導航和狀態按鈕。 [[ On some devices %app_name% can activate full screen mode when in Speak Mode to hide any navigation and status buttons from view.
button_count: 0個按鈕_._ 1個按鈕|| %{n}按鈕 [[ 0 buttons || 1 button || %{n} buttons

restrict_log_access: 限制對我的原始使用情況日誌的訪問。注意：具有訪問權限的主管仍然可以使用用戶帳戶報告。 [[ Restrict access to my raw usage logs. NOTE: User account reports will still be available to supervisors with access permissions.
confirm_logging_code: 在更改日誌訪問設置之前，必須使用當前的日誌代碼確認權限。如果您丟失或忘記了此代碼，請聯繫技術支持。 [[ Before you can change log access settings, you must confirm permission using the current logging code. If you have lost or forgotten this code, please contact technical support.
allow_log_reports: 允許匿名日誌數據用於AAC社區和研究目的（啟用此功能後，未使用的帳戶將保留更長時間） [[ Allow anonymized log data to be used for AAC community and research purposes (unused accounts will be kept longer when this is enabled)
include_geo_in_logs: 在朗讀模式日誌中包括地理位置 [[ Include geolocation in Speak Mode logs
logging_uses_google: 注意：啟用日誌記錄後，在生成報告圖表時，匿名使用情況數據將發送到Google服務。禁用日誌記錄後，將不會更新目標跟踪和徽章獎勵，因為不會記錄任何數據。 [[ NOTE: When logging is enabled, anonymous usage data will be sent to Google services when generating report charts. When logging is disabled, goal tracking and badge awards will not update since no data will be logged.
allow_cookies_checkbox: %app_name%可以出於內部目的（例如錯誤處理，改進功能和跟踪趨勢）跟踪我的操作和綜合瀏覽量 [[ %app_name% can track my actions and pageviews for internal purposes like error handling, improving features and tracking trends

support_intro: 難過嗎？像您認為的那樣無法正常工作？我們一直在尋找使%app_name%更好的方法！請告訴我們您的想法，存在的問題或您希望看到的變得更容易的事情。 [[ Stumped? Something not working like you think it should? We're always on the lookout for ways to make %app_name% better! Please tell us what you think, what's broken, or what you'd like to see made easier.

ios_muted: 該應用程序當前處於靜音狀態，因此您不會聽到語音。要取消靜音，請檢查靜音開關，然後從屏幕底部向上滑動以檢查應用程序級靜音 [[ The app is currently muted, so you will not hear speech. To unmute, check the mute switch, and also swipe up from the bottom of the screen to check for app-level muting

need_to_re_sync: 記住要同步，以便您可以離線訪問所有板！ [[ Remember to sync so you have access to all your boards offline!

limited_supervisor_timeout: 對於不與付費通訊員一起工作的主管，口語模式會話限制為15分鐘。如果您需要更長的會話時間，請考慮一個交流者或評估者帳戶。 [[ Speak mode sessions are limited to 15 minutes for supervisors not working with paid communicators. Please consider a communicator or evaluator account if you need longer sessions.
expired_supervisee_timeout: 與沒有付費或贊助帳戶的溝通者一起使用時，語音模式會話限制為15分鐘。 [[ Speak mode sessions are limited to 15 minutes when working with communicators that don't have a paid or sponsored account.
really_expired_communicator_timeout: 此帳戶已過期，會話限制為15分鐘。如果您需要資金方面的幫助，我們可以提供幫助，請與我們聯繫！ [[ This account has expired, and sessions are limited to 15 minutes. If you need help with funding we can help, please contact us!

eval_intro: 歡迎使用評估工具！該工具有助於評估溝通者訪問和理解按鈕，符號和概念的能力。 [[ Welcome to the Eval Tool! This tool helps evaluate a communicator's ability to access and understand buttons, symbols and concepts.
eval_intro_2: 您可以隨時使用右上方的菜單結束或配置評估。評估完成後，您也可以添加註釋。 [[ You can use the top right menu to end or configure the evaluation any time. You can also add notes once the evaluation has completed.
find_target_intro: 本節顯示了位於不同位置和大小的單個目標，以幫助評估識別和訪問目標的能力。 [[ This section shows a single target at different locations and sizes to help assess ability to identify and access targets.
diff_target_intro: 本節顯示了具有不同大小和佈局的多個目標，以確定區分能力。 [[ This section shows multiple targets at different sizes and layouts to determine ability to differentiate.
symbols_intro: 本節顯示不同樣式的圖片，以查看用戶是否比其他樣式更成功 [[ This section shows different styles of pictures to see if the user has more success with one style over another
find_show_intro: 本部分顯示照片或概念，並提示用戶在下面找到相應的符號 [[ This section shows a photograph or concept and prompts the user to find the corresponding symbol below
open_ended_intro: 本節顯示簡單的場景。鼓勵用戶使用提供的按鈕/鍵進行觀察或討論場景 [[ This section shows simple scenes. Encourage the user to make observations or discuss the scene using the buttons/keys provided
categories_intro: 本部分顯示照片，並提示用戶根據類別對照片進行分類 [[ This section shows photographs and prompts the user to classify them based on their category
inclusion_exclusion_association_intro: 本節顯示照片並提示用戶識別相關或不相關的項目 [[ This section shows photographs and prompts the user to identify related or unrelated items
literacy_intro: 本節顯示圖像和可能單詞的列表（無圖像），以檢查閱讀技巧 [[ This section shows an image and a list of possible words (without images) to check for reading skills
done_eval: 完畢！點擊最後一個按鈕以保存評估並查看結果！ [[ Done! Hit the final button to save the evaluation and see the results!

modeling_for_communication: 通信器建模工作 [[ Work on Modeling for the Communicator
custom_goal: 我會定義我自己的目標 [[ I Will Define My Own Goal
buttons_explainer: 一致的使用很重要！溝通不僅僅是在一個地方發生的事情，為了讓溝通者熟練使用他們的設備，他們需要在不同的地點和情況下全天使用它。 [[ Consistent usage is important! Communication isn't something that just happens in one location, and for communicators to get proficient using their device they need to have it out and available throughout the day, in different locations and situations.
words_explainer: 現在，您的目標是專注於以下方面： [[ Right now you have a goal to focus on the following:
modeling_explainer: 建模是向溝通者展示他們如何使用他們的通信設備說出事情的過程。就像口語交流一樣，在交流者自己適應之前，通常需要進行大量的建模交流，因此要尋找許多機會在不同的環境和一天中的時間進行建模。 [[ Modeling is the process of showing a communicator how they could say things user their communication device. Just like with spoken communication, it often takes a lot of modeled communication before a communicator gets comfortable on their own, so look for many opportunities to model in different environments and times of day.

board_intro_explainer: 您可以構建一個簡短的課程，供人們在選擇此板組時完成，包括解釋和練習短語，供他們使用該板組找到。 [[ You can build a short lesson that people will walk through when they choose this board set, including explanations and practice phrases for them to find using the board set.
add_intro_section: 添加介紹部分 [[ Add Intro Section
finding_a_home_board: 尋找合適的家庭委員會 [[ Finding the Right Home Board
finding_home_board1: 使用交流工具時，主頁是您快速說出一些事情的起點，但也可以跳入更深層次的話題。有一個好的起點很重要，但是有很多不同風格的交流板，而且並不總是很清楚哪個是最好的。每個人都是不同的。以下是一些不同風格的家庭板，詳細說明了它們為何有用。 [[ When using a communication tool, the home board is your starting point to say some things quickly but also jump off into deeper topics. It's important to have a good starting place, but there's lots of different styles of communication boards out there, and it's not always clear which is the best. Every person is different. Here are some different styles of home boards with some detail about why they might be useful.
finding_home_board2: 當您找到有意義的主板時，請點擊菜單並選擇“設為主頁”以使其成為您的主板。 [[ When you find a home board that makes sense, hit the menu and choose "Set as Home" to make it your home board.

supverisor_intro: 主管與用戶帳戶相關聯，並且可以完全訪問用戶帳戶。他們可以更改他們的主頁，查看和編輯他們的私人董事會，查看報告等。將治療師、父母等添加為主管可能很有價值，但請記住主管擁有完整的帳戶訪問權限，因此請注意誰您添加為主管。 [[ Supervisors are linked to a user's account and can have full access to the user's account. They can change their home board, see and edit their private boards, see reports, etc. It can be valuable for therapists, parents, etc. to be added as supervisors, but remember that supervisors have full account access, so be aware of who you add as supervisors.

troubleshooting_intro: 此工具可以幫助測試預期或需要的功能，以便 %app_name% 正常運行。一些測試將自動運行，而另一些可能需要手動測試。如果您遇到任何意外情況，請點擊頁面底部的“支持”鏈接並報告問題。 [[ This tool can help test for functionality that is expected or required in order for %app_name% to function correctly. Some tests will run automatically, while others may require manual testing. If you come across anything unexpected please hit the 'Support' link at the bottom of the page and report the problem.

give_as_a_gift: 贈送%app_name%作為禮物 [[ Give %app_name% as a Gift
gift_explainer: %app_name% 可以成為開發溝通者的強大工具。如果您認識可以從訪問 %app_name% 中受益的人，您可以代表他們購買會員資格。當您這樣做時，您將收到一封包含禮品代碼的電子郵件，該代碼可用於為 %app_name% 用戶兌換您的禮物。 [[ %app_name% can be a powerful tool for developing communicators. If you know someone who could benefit from access to %app_name%, you can purchase a membership on their behalf. When you do you will receive an email with a gift code that can be used to redeem your gift for a %app_name% user.
purchase_complete: 購買完成！謝謝！ [[ Purchase complete! Thank you!
gift_code_in_email: 您應該會收到一封電子郵件，其中包含與此次購買相關的禮品代碼。您可以將電子郵件轉發給預期的收件人，或者想出一種更有創意的方式將代碼發送給他們（我聽說小號讓事情變得令人興奮）。如果您在幾分鐘內沒有看到電子郵件，請務必檢查您的垃圾郵件箱。 [[ You should receive an email with the gift code associated with this purchase. You can forward the email to the intended recipient, or come up with a more creative way to get the code to them (I hear trumpets make things exciting). Make sure to check your spam box if you're not seeing the email come through within a few minutes.
gift_go_to_web_site: 要作為禮物購買，請在您的網絡瀏覽器中訪問coughdrop.com。 [[ To purchase as a gift, please visiting coughdrop.com in your web browser.
how_much_to_gift: 為了讓盡可能多的人使用%app_name%，我們提供靈活的“按需付費”定價。如果您有能力支付更多費用，您的捐款將有助於將 %app_name% 捐贈給更多有需要的家庭！ [[ To make %app_name% accessible to as many people as possible, we offer flexible "pay-what-you-can" pricing. If you can afford to pay more, your contribution will help gift %app_name% to additional families in need!

inflections_review_tool: 曲折審查工具 [[ Inflections Review Tool
inflections_tool_explainer: CoughDrop 是一個支持多種語言和交互的開源工具。這個 Inflections Review Tool 允許我們在構建語言單詞列表時從多個來源收集信息。擁有準確的詞形信息有助於我們更好地支持我們的社區。 請記住，此工具收集的所有信息都將免費在線發布，並提供開放許可，供他人使用和受益。 [[ CoughDrop is an open source tool that supports multiple languages and interactions. This Inflections Review Tool allows us to collect information from multiple sources as we build out language word lists. Having accurate information on word forms helps us better support our communities. Remember, all information collected by this tool will be released for free online with an open license for others to use and benefit from.
inflections_tips: TIPS：有些詞有多種類型。一些替代類型是如此模糊，以至於它們不值得包括在內，想想普通演講者可能會說什麼。如果單詞已經變形（“look”），請確保在第一個框中輸入其詞根（“look”）。某些動詞/副詞的一些變形沒有意義，請在方框中填上“N/A”。對於對立面，只要做最明顯的（如果有的話）。如果您不確定某個單詞，不要害怕跳過它！ [[ TIPS: Some words have multiple types. Some alternate types are so obscure that they're not really worth including, think about what an average speaker might say. If the word is alreeady inflected ("looking") make sure to enter its root ("look") in the first box. Some inflections for certain verbs/adverbs don't make sense, please put "N/A" in the box. For opposites, just do the most obvious if any. If you're unsure about a word, don't be afraid to skip it!

trends_explainer: %app_name% 用戶可以選擇記錄他們的使用數據，以供個人和團隊分析和參考。每當有人選擇加入數據記錄時，我們還會詢問他們是否願意與獨立研究人員分享其使用數據的匿名記錄。我們與非營利研究組織合作，對這些數據進行匯總分析，以更好地了解 AAC 的使用情況，並研究如何改進支持。 [[ %app_name% users can opt-in to recording their usage data for personal and team analysis and reference. Whenever someone opts-in to data logging, we also ask if they would be willing to share an anonymized record of their usage data with independent researchers. We collaborate with non-profit research organizations to analyze this data in aggregate to provide better insights into AAC use and to investigate how supports can be improved.
trends_explainer2: 如果您有興趣進行 AAC 研究，請考慮與我們聯繫以了解有關此重要項目的更多信息。以下是可以匿名和匯總收集的數據類型的一些示例，以幫助 AAC 研究。所有單詞使用信息僅基於選擇匿名研究和報告的用戶的匯總數據。 [[ If you are interested in conducting AAC research, please consider reaching out to us to learn more about this important project. Below are some examples of the types of data that can be collected, anonymously and in aggregate, to help aid AAC research. All word usage information is based on aggregate data only from users who have opted in to anonymized research and reporting.

data_summary_2: 我們希望這個小數據樣本能夠幫助您思考一些其他問題，我們都可以通過匿名 AAC 使用數據的幫助來回答這些問題。我們有超過 %{cnt} 位通訊員選擇以嚴格保密和受保護的方式與研究人員分享他們的匿名使用數據。 [[ We hope this small data sample has helped you think of some of the additional questions we could all benefit from answering with the help of anonymized AAC usage data. We have over %{cnt} communicators who have opted in to sharing their anonymized usage data with researchers, in a strictly private and protected manner.

choose_a_word_list: 從下面的預編譯核心單詞列表中選擇一個，或自定義一個，或創建您自己的。 %app_name% 使用此列表來跟踪按下的按鈕是核心還是邊緣，以幫助長期語言發展。 [[ Select from one of the precompiled core word lists below, or customize one, or create your own. %app_name% uses this list to track which button pressed are core vs. fringe to help with long-term language development.

welcome_to_speak_mode: 歡迎來到說話模式！ [[ Welcome to Speak Mode!
speak_mode_intro_1: 說話模式是%app_name%最重要的部分！當您處於說話模式時，您可以點擊任何按鈕將其添加到頂部的框中。根據您的設置，它還會在您按下按鈕時說出這些按鈕。您可以點擊頂部的方框說出整個句子，或使用其他按鈕返回主頁、退格或清除方框。 [[ Speak Mode is the most important part of %app_name%! When you are in Speak Mode, you can hit any button to add it to the box at the top. Depending on your settings, it will also speak the buttons as you hit them. You can hit the box at the top to speak the whole sentence, or use the other buttons to return home, backspace or clear the box.
speak_mode_intro_2: 當您想退出說話模式時，只需點擊右上角的菜單並選擇“退出說話模式”。然後你可以選擇一個主板，對板進行更改，更改用戶偏好，查看使用報告等。 [[ When you want to exit Speak Mode just hit the menu in the top right corner and select "Exit Speak Mode". Then you can pick a home board, make changes to boards, change user preferences, check out usage reports, etc.

compare_notes: 市面上有很多通信應用程序和設備，有時很難知道哪些對您的通信器有用。有些應用程序只能在 iPad 上運行，而有些應用程序不能與硬件一起使用或定制有限。我們想確保您了解 %app_name% 可以提供的所有內容，因此我們匯總了下面的比較表。 [[ There are lots of communication apps and devices out there, and sometimes it's hard to know what will work well for your communicator. Some apps only run on an iPad and some won't work with hardware or have limited customization. We want to make sure you know everything %app_name% can offer, so we've put together the comparison chart below.

proud_of_features: 如您所見，我們為 %app_name% 所做的一切感到非常自豪。我們希望構建一些可以隨著溝通者的需求隨著時間的推移而發展和變化的東西，因此內置了許多定制來幫助支持每個人的需求。 [[ As you can see, we're pretty proud of everything %app_name% can do. We wanted to build something that could stay with communicators as their needs develop and change over time, so there are a lot of customizations built-in to help support the needs of each individual.
please_share_coughdrop: 對你所看到的感到興奮？請與其他人分享%app_name%，以幫助傳播好消息！ [[ Excited by what you see? Please share %app_name% with others to help spread the good word!

to_see_coughdrop_for_yourself: 看看 %app_name% 到底有多強大和靈活！ [[ to see how powerful and flexible %app_name% really is!
bad_board_import: 導入您的電路板時出錯。請確保您上傳的文件有效，然後重試。 [[ There was an error importing your boards. Please make sure you uploaded a valid file and try again.
import_board_finished_redirecting: 導入完成！你應該被引導到新的董事會...... [[ Import finished! You should be directed to the new board...
importing_boards_please_wait: 正在導入電路板，這可能需要幾分鐘... [[ Importing boards, this could take a few minutes...
notifications_settings: 作為主管，您可以訪問與您合作的溝通者的看板和使用報告。如果您願意，您還可以打開通知，並定期接收有關通訊器進度的更新，甚至選擇接收來自已將您添加為主管的通訊器的短信。 [[ As a supervisor, you'll have access to boards and usage reports for the communicators you work with. If you'd like, you can also turn on notifications, and receive regular updates on communicator progress, or even opt-in to receiving text messages from communicators that have added you as a supervisor.
communicator_notifications: 啟用日誌記錄後，您可以選擇接收定期電子郵件，其中包含一段時間內的通信詳細信息，包括當前目標和單詞使用情況。這可以幫助每個人保持一致，並且可以成為幫助溝通者不斷進步的寶貴工具。 [[ When logging is enabled, you can opt to receive regular emails with details on communication over time, including current goals and word usage. This can help keep everyone on the same page and can be a valuable tool is helping communicators make continual progress.
summary_emails: 您需要多久發送一次摘要電子郵件？ [[ How often do you want summary emails?
comm_preference: 您希望溝通者如何向您發送消息？ [[ How would you like communicators to message you?
via_text: 作為短信 [[ As Text Messages

available_under_profile: 您可以隨時在“我的帳戶”的“個人資料”部分更改這些和其他通知首選項。 [[ You can change these and other notification preferences under the "Profile" section of "My Account" at any time.
youre_all_set_again: 你都準備好了（再次）！ [[ You're All Set (Again)!
done_setup_2: 現在您應該知道開始使用 %app_name% 所需的一切了！如果您遇到困難，您可以隨時點擊儀表板上的“支持”鏈接來訪問您的 YouTube 頻道或操作指南。祝你好運！ [[ Now you should know everything you need to get started using %app_name%! If you ever get stumped, you can always hit the "Support" link on the dashboard to access your YouTube channel or How-To Guides. Good luck!
return_to_dashboard: 返回儀表板 [[ Return to the Dashboard
watch_video: 觀看培訓視頻 [[ Watch the Training Video
usage_1: %app_name% 是一個生成語音的工具。您可以點擊按鈕說出單詞或句子，或拼寫單詞。 [[ %app_name% is a tool for generating speech. You can hit buttons to speak words or sentences, or to spell words.
usage_2: %app_name% 不僅適用於非語言交流者。一些溝通者仍在學習，或者只是在某些時候需要幫助，並且擁有像 %app_name% 這樣的 AAC“拐杖”可能是一個很好的支持工具。 [[ %app_name% isn't just for nonverbal communicators. Some communicators are still learning, or need help only some of the time, and having an AAC "crutch" like %app_name% can be a great support tool.
usage_3: %app_name% 可以在任何系統上運行。您可以在主要應用商店中免費下載它，或者安裝 Windows 應用程序或在 Web 瀏覽器中使用它。使用您喜歡的任何設備。 [[ %app_name% can run on any system. You can find it in the major app stores as a free download, or install the Windows app or use it in your web browser. Use whatever device you like.
usage_4: 有些人擔心使用 AAC 的交流者永遠不會自己說話。然而，最近的研究表明，許多 AAC 用戶在他們更加舒適或熟練後就會轉向語音交流。 [[ Some people worry that communicators who use AAC will never speak on their own. However, recent research has shown that many AAC users move on to vocal communication once they are more comfortable or proficient.
picking_a_home_board: 選擇一個家庭板 [[ Picking a Home Board
home_boards_1: 每個人都是獨一無二的，所以通常每個溝通者的詞彙集對他們來說也是獨一無二的。使用 %app_name%，您可以選擇一個入門套件（或構建您自己的套件），並一遍又一遍地對其進行個性化設置。 [[ Everyone is unique, so often each communicator's vocabulary set will be unique to them too. With %app_name% you can pick a starter set (or build your own), and personalize it over and over again.
home_boards_2: 重要的是要考慮到最終的計劃。如果一個溝通者似乎能夠發展成一個大詞彙量，而不是從少量按鈕開始並隨著時間的推移添加更多，從大量按鈕開始並隱藏一些按鈕可能更容易按鈕開始。 [[ The important thing is to plan with the end in mind. If a communicator seems like they'll be able to grow into a large vocabulary, instead of starting with a small number of buttons and adding more over time, it may be easier to start with a large number of buttons and just hide some of the buttons to start out.
supervisors_1: 在%app_name%中，圍繞傳播者的支持團隊被稱為“主管”。主管是為溝通者建模並與之一起工作的用戶。他們有自己的登錄名，可能是老師或治療師、父母、照顧者等。 [[ In %app_name%, the support team around the communicator are called "supervisors". Supervisors are users that are modeling for and working with a communicator. They have their own login, and might be a teacher or a therapist, a parent, a caregiver, etc.
supervisors_2: 主管被添加到他們的溝通者帳戶中，並且可以在他們自己的設備上查看溝通者的板，因此他們可以熟悉用戶的詞彙以更好地建模，並且如果他們具有編輯權限，則可以添加新的按鈕和短語。 [[ Supervisors are added to their communicator's account, and can see a communicator's boards on their own devices, so they can get comfortable with a user's vocabulary for better modeling, and can add new buttons and phrases if they have editing permission.
modeling_on_boards: 在板上建模 [[ Modeling on Boards
boards_1: %app_name% 帶有許多不同風格的板子。當您使用不同的傳播者時，您可能會遇到不同的板樣式和佈局。每個溝通者都可以從他們周圍的支持者示範如何使用 %app_name% 中受益 [[ %app_name% comes with many different styles of boards. As you work with different communicators you may come across different board styles and layouts. Every communicator can benefit from having the supporters around them model how to use %app_name%
board_2: 建模是語言學習的好工具。研究表明，有人為他們建模的 AAC 用戶在採用和使用 AAC 進行交流方面取得了更大的成功。 [[ Modeling is a great tool to language learning. Research has shown that AAC users who have people modeling for them have better success adopting and communicating using AAC.
board_3: 建模很簡單！您所做的只是在與通訊器交談時按下屏幕上的按鈕。向他們展示如何使用可用的按鈕來表達自己。不要只是模擬請求，模擬各種不同的想法、想法、觀察和問題！您建模的越多，您為傳播者提供的示例就越多，說明您認為使用他們的設備的有效方式。 [[ Modeling is easy! All you do is hit buttons on the screen as you talk to the communicator. Show them how they can use the buttons they have available to express themselves. Don't just model requests, model all kinds of different thoughts, ideas, observations, and questions! The more you model, the more examples you'ree giving the communicator for what you consider valid ways of using their device.
boards_explainer: 在 %app_name% 中，詞彙集由“板”的集合組成。您可以選擇多種不同類型的板，具體取決於通信器的功能級別和需求。當你找到你喜歡的，點擊“Make This My Home Board”，讓它成為交流者的“主頁”，這是交流者每次首次加載應用程序時都會看到的內容。 [[ In %app_name% vocabulary sets are made up of a collection of "boards". There are a number of different types of boards you can choose from, depending on the functional level and needs of your communicator. When you find one you like, hit "Make This My Home Board" to make it the communicator's "home board", which is what the communicator will see every time they first load the app.
easy_to_change_later: 緊張你會選錯板？別擔心！您可以在以後輕鬆更改內容。 [[ Nervous you'll pick the wrong board? Don't fret! You can easily change things later.
youre_all_set: 你準備好了！ [[ You're All Set!
done_setup: 感謝學習！如果您想再次完成此設置，您會在儀表板上的“附加”下找到一個鏈接。 [[ Thanks for learning! If you ever want to go through this setup again, you'll find a link under "Extras" on your dashboard.
continue_to_training: 如果您想了解更多關於如何使用 %app_name% 的信息，您可以繼續我們的教程，或者隨意嘗試自己的操作。 [[ If you'd like to learn a little more about how to use %app_name%, you can continue this our tutorial, or feel free to try things out on your own.
continue_tutorial: 繼續教程 [[ Continue the Tutorial
exiting_speak_mode: 退出說話模式 [[ Exiting Speak Mode
exit_speak_mode_1: 您可以通過點擊右上角的用戶菜單退出說話模式。如果您擔心用戶不小心自行退出語音模式，您可以在用戶的首選項中設置 PIN。 [[ You can exit out of Speak Mode by hitting the user menu in the top right corner. If you're worried about a user accidentally exiting Speak Mode on their own, you can set up a PIN in the user's preferences.
pin_for_exiting_speak_mode: 可選擇設置 4 位密碼以防止退出說話模式： [[ Optionally set a 4-digit pin to prevent exiting Speak Mode:
usage_logging_and_reports: 使用記錄和報告 [[ Usage Logging and Reports
logging_reports_1: %app_name% 具有強大的內置報告工具，可讓護理人員、治療師和支持者查看設備使用時間、最常用詞和目標進度等信息。要使用這些有用的功能，只需啟用日誌記錄。 [[ %app_name% has powerful built-in reporting tools that allow caregivers, therapists and supporters to see things like what time of day the device is being used, most common words and progress toward goals. To use these helpful features, just enable logging.
logging_is_enabled: 日誌記錄已啟用 [[ Logging is Enabled
enable_logging: 啟用日誌記錄 [[ Enable Logging
a_little_about_core: 一點關於核心 [[ A Little About Core
core_1: AAC 的一個重要概念是“核心”詞。核心詞是我們在日常交流中經常使用的詞，可以有多種含義。核心詞可以幫助成長中的溝通者學會一整天的溝通，而不僅僅是在一兩種情況下。 [[ One important concept with AAC is "core" words. Core words are words we use often in everyday communication, and can have multiple meanings. Core words can help growing communicators learn to communicate throughout their day, instead of just in one or two situations.
core_2: 想像一下，如果您只能說“我餓了”、“我累了”或“讓我們再做一次”這樣的預定義短語。你會怎麼問別人他們的一天？你怎麼說你不喜歡某事？我們可以教他們使用核心詞構建自己的短語，而不是試圖思考溝通者可能需要的所有可能的短語。 [[ Imagine if all you could say were predefined phrases like "I'm hungry", "I'm tired", or "Let's do that again." How would you ask someone about their day? How would you say you didn't like something? Instead of trying to think of all possible phrases a communicator might need, we can teach them to build their own phrases using core words.
core_3: 記住要以最終為目的進行計劃，並找到一個包含足夠核心詞的詞彙集，以供交流者成長。 [[ Remember to plan with the end in mind, and find a vocabulary set with enough core words for the communicator to grow into.
select_voice: 現在讓我們選擇一個聲音。這是人們在通訊器按下按鈕時會聽到的聲音。 [[ Now let's pick a voice. This is what people will hear when the communicator hits buttons.
free_trial: 請注意：您仍處於免費試用期，因此目前您只能訪問設備的內置聲音。購買 %app_name% 後，您可以下載 90 多種優質聲音之一。 [[ Keep in mind: you're still in the free trial, so currently you only have access to the device's built-in voices. After you purchase %app_name%, you can download one of over 90 premium voices.
supporter_limited_voices: 您使用的是受限的 %app_name% 帳戶，因此目前您只能訪問設備的內置語音。付費通訊器帳戶還可以下載高級語音以在說話模式下使用。 [[ You are using a limited %app_name% account, so currently you only have access to the device's built-in voices. Paid communicator accounts can also download premium voices for use in Speak Mode.
supporter_modeling_only: 您使用的是僅限建模的 %app_name% 帳戶，因此目前您只能訪問設備的內置聲音。如果您需要訪問高級語音，請考慮購買付費通訊器帳戶。 [[ You are using a modeling-only %app_name% account, so currently you only have access to the device's built-in voices. Consider purchasing a paid communicator account if you need access to premium voices.
paid_voices: 請記住，您還可以瀏覽付費帳戶可以下載到移動和 Windows 應用程序的高級語音。 [[ Remember, you can also browse the premium voices that can be downloaded to mobile and Windows apps for paid accounts.
listen_to_this_voice: 聆聽這個聲音 [[ Listen to This Voice
browse_premium_voices: 瀏覽高級音色 [[ Browse Premium Voices
voice_as_fallback: 如果您打算錄製消息，則此語音將僅用於未附加錄音的任何按鈕，或用於使用鍵盤手動拼寫的單詞。 [[ If you're planning to record messages, this voice will only be used for any buttons that don't have recordings attached to them, or for words that are manually spelled using the keyboard.
supervisors_explainer: %app_name% 與溝通者周圍的支持者團隊合作效果最佳。每個用戶都可以擁有自己的 %app_name% 帳戶（支持者是免費的），傳播者可以通過將團隊成員添加為“主管”來將他們連接到他們的帳戶。 [[ %app_name% works best with a team of supporters around the communicator. Every user can have their own %app_name% account (supporters are free), and communicators can connect team members to their account by adding them as "supervisors".
get_added_as_supervisor: 為了查看與您合作的溝通者的看板和報告，這些用戶需要從他們的儀表板中添加您。您可以鼓勵他們將溝通者周圍的每個人都添加為主管，以幫助建立強大的支持團隊。 %app_name% 提供免費的建模專用帳戶，以幫助每個人參與！ [[ In order to see the boards and reports for communicators you work with, those users need to add you from their dashboard. You can encourage them to add everyone around the communicator as supervisors to help build a strong support team. %app_name% offers free modeling-only accounts to help everyone get involved!
add_lots_of_supervisors: 學習 AAC 最適合傳播者周圍的許多支持者。您可以鼓勵家人、老師、治療師等人註冊免費的支持者帳戶，然後將他們添加為主管，以授予對董事會、報告和目標的訪問權限。 [[ Learning AAC works best with lots of supporters around communicator. You can encourage people like family members, teachers, therapists, etc. to sign up for a free supporter account, and then add them as supervisors to grant access to boards, reports and goals.
add_of_manage_supervisors: 添加或管理主管 [[ Add or Manage Supervisors
accessing_linked_boards: 訪問鏈接板 [[ Accessing Linked Boards
folders_1: 在角落有一個小文件夾圖標或標記的按鈕是鏈接按鈕，這意味著如果您選擇它們，它將帶您到另一個板。這使您可以擁有多個級別，其中包含比單個屏幕上容納的更多的單詞和短語。你總是可以通過點擊主頁按鈕回到第一個板。 [[ Buttons that have a little folder icon or a mark in the corner are linked buttons, which means that if you select them it will take you to another board. This lets you have multiple levels, with more words and phrases than could fit on a single screen. You can always get back to the first board by hitting the home button.
folders_2: 默認情況下，鏈接按鈕不說話，當通信器點擊非鏈接按鈕時，它們將被帶回主控板，但這兩個設置都是可選的，可以在用戶的偏好中更改。 [[ By default linked buttons do not speak, and when the communicator hits a non-linked button they will be taken back to the home board, but both of these settings are optional and can be changed in a user's preferences.
speak_on_select: 每次選擇按鈕後發言 [[ Speak after each button selection
speak_linked_buttons: 即使選擇了鏈接按鈕也能說話 [[ Speak even when linked buttons are selected
unlinked_auto_home_return: 選擇未鏈接的按鈕時返回主頁 [[ Return home when unlinked buttons are selected
access_selection: 這個通訊器將如何選擇按鈕？ [[ How will this communicator be selecting buttons?
touching_or_clicking: 觸摸或點擊 [[ Touching or Clicking
switch_access: 使用開關掃描 [[ Scanning Using a Switch
dwell_tracking: 眼睛或停留跟踪 [[ Eye or Dwell Tracking
access_selection_action: 當通訊器選擇一個按鈕時會發生什麼？ [[ What happens when the communicator selects a button?
home_return_1: 當選擇一個按鈕時，%app_name% 將自動返回主板。這有助於為每個按鈕制定一致的順序（稱為電機計劃），因此我們建議將其作為默認設置，但您可以根據需要進行更改。 [[ When a button is selected %app_name% will automatically return to the home board. This helps develop a consistent sequence for each button (called a motor plan), so we recommend it as the default but you can change it if needed.
return_to_the_home_board: 返回主局 [[ Return to the Home Board
stay_on_the_current_board: 留在當前董事會 [[ Stay on the Current Board
touch_access: 觸摸訪問%app_name% [[ touch access to %app_name%
touch_1: 觸摸或單擊按鈕是 CoughDrop 等通訊板最常見的訪問方法。通過點擊或點擊按鈕，溝通者可以在板之間導航並選擇單詞或短語讓系統為他們說話。 [[ Touching or clicking buttons is the most common access method for communication boards like those in CoughDrop. By tapping or clicking on buttons, communicators can navigate between boards and select words or phrases to have the system speak for them.
touch_2: 一些溝通者需要額外的調整，例如根據他們抬起手指的位置、更大的文本或按鈕之間更大的間隙進行選擇。這些都可以從 CoughDrop 內的用戶“首選項”視圖中進行配置。 [[ Some communicators need additional accommodations, like selecting based on where they lift their finger, bigger text, or larger gaps between buttons. These are all configurable from a user's "Preferences" view inside of CoughDrop.
scanning_access: 掃描訪問 %app_name% [[ scanning access in %app_name%
scanning_1: 一些傳播者有運動控制問題，這使得他們很難點擊屏幕上的小按鈕。如果他們可以擊中更大的目標，如藍牙或稱為“開關”的連接按鈕，甚至只是擊中屏幕，那麼 %app_name% 可以將板分成越來越小的塊，一次“掃描”它們，然後等待供用戶使用他們的開關進行選擇。 [[ Some communicators have motor control issues which make it hard for them to hit small buttons on a screen. If they can hit larger targets like a bluetooth or connected button called a "Switch", or even just hit the screen, then %app_name% can break the board up into smaller and smaller chunks, "scan" through them one at a time, and wait for the user to select using their switch.
scanning_2: %app_name% 可以按行、列或自定義區域進行掃描，甚至可以使用不同的聲音或音量進行掃描，以減少溝通者的困惑。它適用於外部開關，或者您可以將屏幕設置為一個巨大的按鈕，或兩個獨立的按鈕。所有這些設置都在用戶的“首選項”視圖中可用。 [[ %app_name% can scan by row, column, or custom region, and can even use a different voice or volume for scanning to make things less confusing for the communicator. It works with external switches, or you can make the screen a giant button, or two independent buttons. All of these settings are available in a user's "Preferences" view.
dwell_access: 在 %app_name% 中停留訪問 [[ dwell access in %app_name%
dwell_1: 對於沒有一致運動控制的交流者，眼動儀有時可能是一種有效的訪問方法。眼動儀是一種跟踪眼球運動的特殊相機。當通信者的視線停留在按鈕上一段時間時，系統可以代表通信者選擇該按鈕。或者，一些系統可以使用攝像頭或傳感器跟踪聽覺或身體運動，將鼠標光標視為操縱桿，當光標“停留”在按鈕上時，它被選中。眼動或駐留跟踪可能比開關訪問更快，但更難正確校準。 [[ For communicators without consistent motor control, eye trackers can sometimes be an effective access method. An eye tracker is a special camera that tracks eye movements. When a communicator's gaze lingers on a button for a period of time, the system can select that button on behalf of the communicator. Alternatively, some systems can track hear or body movement using cameras or sensors to treat the mouse cursor like a joystick, and when the cursor "dwells" over a button, it is selected. Eye or dwell tracking can be faster than switch access, but is more difficult to calibrate correctly.
dwell_2: %app_name% 可以與任何支持光標控制的眼動儀或系統一起使用（我們已經測試了 Tobii、MyGaze、eyetech 和 LC Technologies 以及 EagleEyes 硬件）。只需禁用“點擊”事件，因為 %app_name% 會自行處理這些事件。您可以在用戶的“首選項”視圖中微調跟踪設置。某些系統，如 EyeTribe 和 EyeX，也需要在“首選項”中進行額外配置。 [[ %app_name% can work with any eye tracker or system that supports cursor control (we have tested Tobii, MyGaze, eyetech and LC Technologies, and EagleEyes hardware). Just disable "click" events since %app_name% handles these on its own. You can fine-tune the tracking settings on the user's "Preferences" view. Some systems, like EyeTribe and EyeX, will require additional configuration in "Preferences" as well.
modeling_1: 當某人正在學習交流時（無論是通過說話還是使用 AAC），重要的是他們有很多支持交流者幫助他們看到好的例子並正確學習。 [[ When someone is learning to communicate (whether by speaking or using AAC), it's important that they have lots of supporting communicators helping them see good examples and learn correctly.
modeling_2: 在 AAC 世界中，許多人稱之為“建模”，重要的是 AAC 用戶周圍的人向他們展示如何有效使用他們的設備的示例（“你想要一個 cookie？讓我告訴你，你可以說*想要*和然後 *cookie*")。 [[ In the AAC world many people call this "modeling", and it's important that people around AAC users are showing them examples of how to effectively use their device ("You want a cookie? Let me show you, you could say *want* and then *cookie*").
modeling_3: 在%app_name%中，如果您三次點擊清除按鈕，您將看到一個指示“建模模式”的手指圖標。當處於建模模式時，%app_name% 跟踪作為建模操作按下的按鈕，因此它們不會顯示在通信器的使用報告中。再次點擊“清除”以退出建模模式。 [[ In %app_name% if you triple-tap the clear button, you'll see a finger icon indicating "Modeling Mode". When in Modeling Mode %app_name% tracks buttons pressed as modeling actions so they don't show up in a communicator's usage reports. Tap "Clear" again to leave Modeling Mode.
extra_reports_1: 主管還可以查看用戶的通信歷史記錄。出於隱私原因，默認情況下禁用日誌和報告，但如果您啟用它們，則用戶的主管可以看到他們的通信隨著時間的推移如何進行。 [[ Supervisors can also review a user's communication history. For privacy reasons logs and reports are disabled by default, but if you enable them then the user's supervisors can see how their communication is progressing over time.
extra_reports_2: 報告包括信息，例如通訊器最常使用的詞、設備在一天中的什麼時間使用，甚至他們在屏幕上點擊的位置。這些信息可以幫助團隊保持協調和完成任務。 [[ Reports include information like what words the communicator is using most often, what time of day the device is being used, and even where on the screen they're hitting. This information can help the team stay coordinated and on task.
extra_home_boards_1: %app_name% 有許多不同的主頁板，您可以立即開始使用，或者隨時復制和個性化。有些板子有幾個大按鈕，有些板子有很多小按鈕。 [[ %app_name% has a number of different home boards that you can start using right away, or copy and personalize as you go. Some boards have a few large buttons, and some have many small buttons.
extra_home_boards_2: 更多的按鈕意味著更多的表達選項，但是一些用戶在他們可以可靠地點擊的按鈕上受到限制（請記住，您現在可以隨時隱藏您想要稍後添加的按鈕，因此看起來“太忙”的板可能實際上是他們可以隨著時間的推移而成長的東西）。 [[ More buttons means more options for expression, but some users are limited in how small a button they can reliably hit (keep in mind you can always hide buttons for now that you want to add later, so a board that looks "too busy" may actually be something they can grow into over time).
intro_1: 感謝您註冊%app_name%！我們很高興您能來到這裡，並希望 %app_name% 對您有所幫助。如果您是 %app_name% 的新手，本演練將幫助您入門。 [[ Thanks for signing up for %app_name%! We're excited you're here and hope %app_name% makes a difference for you. If you're new to %app_name%, this walkthrough will help you get started.
intro_3: 首先，記住您的用戶名（%{un}），您可以在下載免費應用程序時使用它登錄。您還可以在任何帶有網絡瀏覽器的計算機上編輯板子、練習和查看報告！ [[ First, remember your username (%{un}), you can use it to log in when you download the free app. You can also edit boards, practice and view reports from any computer with a web browser!
intro_2: 接下來，我們想教一些關於 AAC（Augmentative and Alternative Communication）的知識，然後幫助確保您正確設置了 %app_name%。點擊底角的“下一步”開始。 [[ Next we'd like to teach just a little about AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication), and then help make sure you've got %app_name% set up correctly. Hit "Next" in the bottom corner to get started.
skip_to_dashboard:
暫時跳過，返回
儀表板 [[ Skip For Now, Return
to the Dashboard
skip_to_board_choice:
現在跳過，只是
幫我選擇一個板 [[ Skip For Now, Just
Help Me Choose a Board
dashboard_1: 現在讓我們繼續討論如何開始使用%app_name%！ [[ Now let's move on to how to get started using %app_name%!
dashboard_2: 當您第一次登錄 %app_name% 時，您將從儀表板上開始。在這裡，您可以查看通知、訪問您的個人資料和偏好，並瀏覽可用的主頁。 [[ When you first log in to %app_name%, you'll start on the dashboard. Here you can see notifications, access your profile and preferences, and browse through the available home boards.
communicators_skip_dashboard: 主管帳戶在首次登錄時始終會看到儀表板，但通信帳戶選擇跳過儀表板並在啟用時直接進入主頁。 [[ Supervisor accounts always see the dashboard when they first log in, but communicator accounts to opt to skip the dashboard and go straight to the home board when enabled.
logs_and_notes: 日誌和註釋 [[ Logs and Notes
logs_1: 除了查看使用歷史記錄之外，主管還可以訪問每個通信會話的詳細報告，並可以與用戶的團隊進行記錄和共享，因此每個人都知道當前的策略是什麼，什麼是有效的或無效的。 [[ In addition to reviewing usage history, supervisors can access detailed reports on each communication session, and can make and share notes with the user's team, so everyone knows what the current strategy is and what is or isn't working well.
start_deciding: 除了選擇板外，還有一些其他的設置可以根據溝通者的情況而改變。請記住，您以後可以隨時在“首選項”下更改這些設置。 [[ In addition to selecting a board, there are some other settings that can change based on the communicator's situation. Keep in mind that you can always change these settings later under "Preferences".
text_placement: 您希望按鈕如何顯示？ [[ How do you want buttons to appear?
text_above_pictures: 上面有文字的圖片 [[ Pictures with text above
no_pictures: 純文字（無圖片） [[ Text only (no pictures)
text_below_pictures: 圖片下方有文字 [[ Pictures with text below
text_above_suggestion: 如果您不確定，上面有文字是從圖片開始但隨著時間的推移學習閱讀單詞的好選擇。 [[ If you're not sure, having text above is a good option for starting with pictures but learning to read words over time.
symbol_background_question: 您希望圖片如何顯示？ [[ How do you want pictures to display?
clear_background: 與按鈕匹配的背景 [[ With a background matching the button
always_white_background: 總是有白色背景 [[ Always with a white background
always_black_background: 總是有黑色背景 [[ Always with a black background
high_contrast_black_background: 黑色背景的高對比度 [[ High contrast with a black background
background_suggestion: 對於大多數用戶來說，匹配按鈕顏色效果很好，但對於一些具有白色背景的溝通者來說，有助於對比和識別。 [[ For most users, matching the button color works well, but for some communicators having a white background can help with contrast and recognition.
which_symbols: 你更喜歡哪個符號？ [[ Which symbols do you prefer?
use_original_symbols: 使用董事會的原始符號 [[ Use the board's original symbols
opensymbols: Opensymbols.org 免費符號庫 [[ Opensymbols.org free symbol libraries
lessonpix_library: LessonPix 符號庫 [[ LessonPix symbol library
pcs: Tobii Dynavox 的 PCS 符號 [[ PCS Symbols by Tobii Dynavox
show_more_libraries: 顯示更多庫 [[ Show more libraries
twemoji: 表情符號圖標（由 Twitter 創作） [[ Emoji icons (authored by Twitter)
noun_project: 名詞項目黑色輪廓 [[ The Noun Project black outlines
arasaac: ARASAAC 免費符號 [[ ARASAAC free symbols
tawasol: Tawasol 符號庫 [[ Tawasol symbol library
premium_upgrade_required: 注意：您需要先在賬單頁面上購買高級符號升級，然後才能使用這些符號。 [[ NOTE: You will need to purchase the premium symbols upgrade on your billing page before you can use these symbols.
lessonpix_upgrade_required: 注意：您需要在您的個人資料頁面上將您的 LessonPix 帳戶連接到您的 %app_name% 帳戶，然後才能使用這些符號。 [[ NOTE: You will need to connect your LessonPix account to your %app_name% account on your Profile page before you can use these symbols.
symbols_suggestion: 一些傳播者已經知道符號庫或可以從某種樣式中受益，並且可以將%app_name%設置為他們熟悉的使用。使用電路板的原始符號也可以。 [[ Some communicators already know a symbol library or can benefit from a certain style, and %app_name% can be set to use they're familiar with. Using the board's original symbols is also fine.
speak_mode_1: 一旦您選擇了一個主頁板，您就可以通過啟動到說話模式來訪問它。 [[ Once you've selected a home board you can access it by launching into Speak Mode.
extra_speak_mode_2: 當你處於說話模式時，你可以點擊按鈕讓他們說話，並添加到頂部的發聲框中。如果您點擊發聲框，它將說出位於那裡的所有按鈕。退格和清除按鈕可以幫助保持句子窗口清潔。 [[ When you're in Speak Mode you can hit buttons to have them spoken, and added to the vocalization box at the top. If you hit the vocalization box it'll speak all the buttons that are located there. The backspace and clear buttons can help keep the sentence window clean.
gift_codes_for: 禮品代碼 [[ Gift Codes for
discounts_for: 折扣兌換 [[ Discount Redemptions for
multi_code_intro: 感謝您使用%app_name%！這個組織 [[ Thank you for using %app_name%! This organization
multi_code_intro2: 已設置多個禮品代碼，可在 %app_name% 內使用。您可以將這些禮品代碼分發給可以在註冊時輸入這些代碼的用戶，以免費訪問 %app_name% 的通信功能。 [[ has been set up with multiple gifts code for use within %app_name%. bulk_purchase_intro: 感謝您有興趣購買%app_name%！ %app_name% 是一個強大的工具，用於開發溝通者以及他們周圍的支持團隊。我們相信 %app_name% 可以為您合作的溝通者帶來改變。請輸入以下信息以完成購買。如果您有任何問題，請隨時聯繫我們的支持團隊。 [[ Thank you for your interest in purchasing %app_name%! %app_name% is a powerful tool for developing communicators, and the support team around them. We are confident that %app_name% can make a difference for the communicators you work with. Please enter the following information to complete your purchase. aac: 增強和替代溝通 [[ Augmentative and Alternative Communication
stash_explanation_2: 出於許多不同的原因。這與使用鍵盤在網上寫信息真的沒有什麼不同，只是有些人甚至要大聲說出他們想說的話。使用圖片來幫助識別單詞和想法有時可以更容易找到合適的單詞。 [[ for many different reasons. It's really not that different from using a keyboard to write messages online, except some people have to type even what they want to say out loud. Using pictures to help identify words and ideas can sometimes make it easier to find the right words to say.

check_logging_with_user_first: 請確保通信者了解您記錄他們通信的原因，並在繼續之前獲得他們的許可。 [[ Please make sure the communicator understands why you are logging their communication, and get their permission before proceeding.
logging_1: 當您啟用日誌記錄時，包括按下的按鈕、一天中的時間、屏幕大小和方向等硬件特徵在內的所有信息都會代表您收集並存儲在雲中。其中一些報告使用谷歌圖表來呈現匿名信息，如每天按下的按鈕和按類型劃分的部分語音頻率。此數據用於生成報告以幫助支持團隊跟踪進度並設定有效目標，並且可以隨時禁用。 [[ When you enable logging, information including buttons pressed, time of day, hardware characteristics like screen size and orientation are all collected and stored in the cloud on your behalf. Some of these reports use Google Charts to render anonymized information like buttons pressed per day and parts of speech frequency by type. This data is used to generate reports to help the support team track progress and set effective goals, and can be disabled at any time.
logging_2: 為幫助支持 AAC 研究，%app_name% 使用所有記錄的使用信息的匿名摘要與社區分享一般趨勢。這包括匯總數據，如流行的核心詞、總會話時間和典型的建模頻率。 %app_name% 還與研究機構合作，提供來自啟用匿名研究支持的 %app_name% 用戶的匿名通信信息。不會共享用戶個人資料和可識別信息，但可能會公開發布匿名數據，如果您不喜歡與公共研究人員共享此用戶的 AAC 通信，您可以在此處或在用戶的偏好頁面。請注意，選擇加入的非活動用戶在很長一段時間內不會從我們的系統中刪除，以繼續為研究人員提供支持。 [[ To help support research in AAC, %app_name% uses anonymized summaries of all logged usage information to share general trends with the community. This includes summary data like popular core words, total session time and typical frequency of modeling. %app_name% also collaborates with research organizations by providing anonymized communication information from %app_name% users who have enabled anonymous research support. User profiles and identifiable information are not shared, but the anonymized data may be published publicly, and if you're not comfortable sharing this user's AAC communication with public researchers, you can opt out here or on the user's preferences page. Note that inactive users who have opted in will not be deleted from our system for an extended period of time, to continue to provide support to researchers.
allow_research: 與研究人員和社區摘要報告共享匿名使用數據 [[ Share anonymized usage data with researchers and in community summary reports
allow_publishing: 允許將匿名日誌包含在公共數據集中以進行自動化研究和分析 [[ Allow anonymized logs to be included in public data sets for automated research and analysis
logging_3: 此外，如果您願意，%app_name% 可以跟踪 GPS 數據，以便更好地了解用戶通信如何根據位置發生變化。可以從用戶的首選項頁面從系統中手動清除所有記錄數據。如果您想在故障排除時選擇退出聚合數據收集或禁止 %app_name% 管理員查看您的日誌，您可以在用戶的首選項中選擇“完全限制日誌訪問” [[ Additionally, if you'd like, %app_name% can track GPS data to provide better insights into how user communication changes based on location. All logging data can be manually cleared from the system from a user's Preferences page. If you would like to opt-out of aggregate data collection or disable %app_name% administrators from seeing your logs while troubleshooting you can choose "Completely Restrict Log Access" on the user's Preferences

how_to_transfer: 一旦您準備好長期使用%app_name%，將您的電路板和日誌從該評估帳戶轉移到一個新的永久帳戶是有意義的。為此，請註冊一個免費試用帳戶並在下方輸入該新帳戶的登錄信息。評估過程中創建的板和日誌將全部轉移到新帳戶。 [[ Once you are ready to use %app_name% long-term, it will make sense to transfer your boards and logs out of this evaluation account and into a new, permanent account. To do this, sign up for a free trial account and the enter the login information for that new account below. The boards and logs created during the evaluation will all be transferred to the new account.

enter_log_explainer: 一些通信器在數字通信系統和印刷通信系統之間切換，這意味著您可能需要手動輸入通信會話以使所有內容保持最新。為此，只需輸入通訊器使用的單詞或短語，每行按一個“按鈕”即可。 [[ Some communicators switch between digital and printed communication systems, which means that you may want to manually enter communication sessions to keep everything up-to-date. To do so, just enter the words or phrases the communicator used, with one "button" press per line.
paint_levels_explainer: %app_name% 板可以內置開發級別，因此您可以從基礎開始，隨著溝通者的發展逐漸添加詞彙和資源。您可以使用繪圖工具通過同時更新多個按鈕來更輕鬆地定義增長級別。 [[ %app_name% boards can have levels of development built-in, so you can start basic and gradually add vocabulary and resources as the communicator develops. You can use the paint tool to make defining growth levels easier by updating multiple buttons at the same time.
levels_are_suggestions: 注意：級別描述是一個可選建議，您可能希望根據您正在使用的目標受眾定義自己的級別。一般來說，最好跳過中間級別，至少使用級別 1 和級別 10 作為進度點。 [[ NOTE: The level descriptions are an optional suggestion, you may want to define your own levels based on the target audience you are working with. In general it is better to skip middle levels and at least use Level 1 and Level 10 as progression points.

chances_to_use_word: 您可以通過展示他們來幫助您的溝通者學習使用他們的話！尋找機會在不同的活動和環境中使用“%{word}”這個詞，這樣他們就會更熟悉這個詞。 [[ You can help your communicator learn to use their words by showing them! Look for opportunities to use the word "%{word}" in different activities and settings so they will get more comfortable with the word.
more_core_words: 以下是 CoughDrop 看到的其他一些詞，可能對您的溝通者有用。 [[ Below are some other words CoughDrop sees might be useful to work with for your communicators.
target_words_explainer: 以下每個詞都是根據可用的用戶活動、目標、在應用程序中的時間等建議的。包含一些詞的原因不同，您可以查看以下原因，或在 %app_name% 內設置目標以跟踪這些詞的進度. [[ Each of the following words were suggested based on available user activity, goals, time in the app, etc. Some words are included for different reasons, you can review the reasons below, or set a goal inside of %app_name% to track progress toward these words.
back_to_list: 返回目錄 [[ Back to List
make_goal_for_words: 選擇目標詞 [[ Choose Goal Words
target_words_explainer2: 當您使用 %app_name% 時，該應用會自動生成目標詞，您可以選擇與您的交流者一起關注這些詞。 [[ As you use %app_name%, the app will automatically generate target words that you can choose to focus on with your communicator.
target_user_words: 以下是您可能要考慮使用的一些詞。 %app_name% 全天展示了使用目標詞的不同想法，因此請定期查看。 [[ Below are some words you may want to consider using. %app_name% shows different ideas throughout the day for ways to use the target words, so check back regularly.
target_no_user_words: 建議列表將全天更新，因此請定期查看活動的新想法，與您的溝通者一起嘗試。 [[ The list of suggestions will update throughout the day, so check back regularly for new ideas of activities to try with your communicator.
link_at_top_of_window: 您以後可以通過點擊此窗口頂部的“目標”列表來查看此列表。 [[ You can review this list in the future by hitting the "targets" list at the top of this window.
home_board_required: 你沒有家用板套裝！ Modeling Ideas 從您的主板套裝中的按鈕中提取建議，因此在您選擇主板之前它不會有很多好處。 [[ You don't have a home board set! Modeling Ideas draws suggestions from buttons in your home board set, so it won't do a lot of good until you choose a home board.
help_me_choose_a_home_board: 幫我選擇一個家庭板 [[ Help Me Choose a Home Board
no_data_yet: 對不起！我們目前沒有任何建議給您！我們會不斷添加更多核心詞和建議，所以請稍後再回來查看更多想法！ [[ Sorry! We don't have any suggestions for you right now! We're continually adding more core words and suggestions, so please check back soon for more ideas!
purchase_to_unlock_modeling_ideas: %app_name% 的建模創意需要高級會員才能訪問。建模創意是一個強大的功能，可以為培養溝通者帶來顯著的不同。請考慮購買許可證以訪問這些想法。 [[ %app_name%'s Modeling Ideas require a premium membership to access for users. Modeling Ideas are a powerful feature that can make a significant different for developing communicators. Please consider purchasing a license to access these ideas.
how_did_it_go: 進展如何？ [[ How Did It Go?
repeat_and_model_book: 一起閱讀本書，花時間模擬“%{w}”和其他目標詞進行觀察，或提問和回答問題。 [[ Read the book together, taking time to model "%{w}"  and other target words to make observations, or to ask and answer questions.

repeat_and_model_video: 一起觀看視頻，尋找機會對“%{w}”和其他目標詞進行建模，以進行觀察或從視頻中重複。 [[ Watch the video together, looking for opportunities to model "%{w}" and other target words to make observations or repeat from the video.

thanks_for_reporting: 感謝您的報告！ [[ Thanks for reporting!
follow_up_later: 謝謝！試試這個活動，我們稍後會跟進，看看進展如何！ [[ Thanks! Give this activity a try and we'll follow up later to see how it went!
thank_you_for_feedback: 感謝您的反饋，我們會不斷添加新的想法！ [[ Thank you for the feedback, we'll keep adding new ideas!
activity_match_for: 活動匹配 [[ activity a match for
modeling_ideas_intro_1: 您是否知道新的交流者通過觀察他人來學習組合單詞？您知道嬰兒在自己說話之前會聽到數千小時的口語嗎？或者，AAC 專家建議與新用戶進行高達 80% 的通信是在設備上建模的？ [[ Did you know that new communicators learn to combine words by observing others do it first? Did you know that babies hear thousands of hours of spoken language before speaking on their own? Or that AAC experts recommend up to 80% of communication with a new user be modeled on a device?
modeling_ideas_intro_2: 建模或展示如何點擊按鈕進行交流的示例非常重要！當你開始與使用 AAC 的溝通者合作時，尋找機會以不同的方式對不同的詞或相同的詞進行建模。可能需要練習才能感到舒適或看到結果，但研究已經一次又一次地表明，不同的模型會產生多大的影響！ [[ Modeling, or showing examples of how to hit buttons to communicate, is very important! As you start work with communicators who are using AAC, look for chances to model different words, or the same words in different ways. It may take practice to get comfortable or to see results, but research has shown over and over how much of a different modeling makes!
modeling_intro_3: Modeling Ideas 是一個 %app_name% 工具，它會根據用戶目標和日誌歷史記錄中的目標詞每天推荐一些活動。我們希望它可以為您提供很多想法，以幫助您的溝通者成長！ [[ Modeling Ideas is a %app_name% tool that recommends a few activities every day based on target words from your user's goals and log history. We hope it helps give you lots of ideas to help your communicator grow!

They will see your button presses, as well as be able to add visual prompts and start a video or audio call with this device. Other supervisors will be able to follow your actions during pairing. Would you like to accept this pairing?
confirm_following: 想關注你的活動。如果您為此演講模式會話啟用關注，其他主管也將能夠關注您的活動。您想為此演講模式會話啟用關注者嗎？ [[ wants to follow your activity. If you enable following for this Speak Mode session, other supeervisors will also be able to follow your activity. Would you like to enable followers for this Speak Mode session?

core_words_explainer: 核心詞是一種語言中最常見的詞，通常表達多種意圖或含義。對於該用戶，以下單詞列表將被標記為“核心”（而不是“邊緣”）。 [[ Core words are the most common words in a language, and often express multiple intents or meanings. The following list of words will be marked as "core" (as opposed to "fringe") for this user.
requested_phrases_explainer: 傳播者和支持者可以請求將短語或單詞添加到傳播者的詞彙集中。這些請求在此處列出。 [[ Communicators and supporters can request that phrases or words be added to a communicator's vocabulary set. Those requests are listed here.

eye_tracking_beta: 眼睛注視或停留跟踪是 Windows 或其他基於光標的系統上的測試版功能，請聯繫支持以獲取更多信息 [[ Eye-gaze or dwell tracking is a beta feature on Windows or other cursor-based system, please contact support for more information
ios_eye_tracking: Apple Face ID 的內置功能支持有限的視線控制。這種眼睛注視不如專用的眼睛跟踪硬件準確，但結合有限的頭部運動，對於某些交流者來說可能就足夠了。 [[ The built-in features of Apple Face ID support limited eye gaze control. This eye gaze is not as accurate as dedicated eye-tracking hardware, but combined with limited head movement it may be sufficient for some communicators.
supported_eye_trackers: 許多眼動儀將使用光標控制模式在%app_name%中工作。我們為某些設備提供了內置集成，包括 EyeX 和 Eyegaze Edge 跟踪器，並希望盡快添加更多設備。 [[ Many eye trackers will work in %app_name% using cursor control mode. We have built-in integrations for some, including EyeX and Eyegaze Edge trackers, and hope to add more devices soon.

apple_tts_bug: 注意：Apple 的語音引擎中存在一個錯誤，可能導致某些系統語音無法正常工作。如果您遇到這種情況，請嘗試使用高級語音或選擇“系統默認語音”來解決問題。 [[ NOTE: There is a bug in Apple's speech engine which can cause some system voices not to work. If this is happening for you, try using a Premium Voice or selecting "System Default Voice" to get around the problem.

valet_login_explainer: 代客登錄允許您在受信任的設備之外共享臨時用戶名和密碼，而不會暴露您的完整帳戶。當有人使用您的代客登錄時，該設備將只能訪問板和用戶首選項，類似於僅建模帳戶。代客密碼將保持 24 小時或直到您使用正常的用戶名和密碼登錄。之後它將被禁用，直到您手動重新激活它。 [[ Valet login allows you to share a temporary username and password outside of a trusted device without exposing your full account. When someone uses your valet login, that device will have access to boards and user preferences only, similar to a modeling-only account. The valet password will remain available for 24 hours or until you log in using your normal username and password. After that it will be disabled until you manually re-activate it.

goals_explainer1: 目標是幫助溝通者及其支持團隊將當前策略放在首位的一種方式。它們可以很籠統，例如“記住使用核心詞！”或具體如“輸入新設置時使用問候語”。請記住，這些可以是溝通者的目標（“用是或否回答問題”），或圍繞溝通者的支持團隊（“使用提示層次結構”）。 [[ Goals are a way to help the communicator and their support team keep their current strategies top of mind. They can be general like "Remember to use core words!" or specific like "Use greetings when entering a new setting". Remember, these can be goals for the communicator ("Answer questions with yes or no"), or for the support team around the communicator ("Use a prompting hierarchy").
goals_explainer2: 可以使用評估或在用戶日誌上做筆記時跟踪每個溝通者的目標。然後，這些狀態更新用於顯示目標隨時間進展情況的一般報告。 [[ Goals can be tracked for each communicator using assessments, or when making notes on a user's logs. These status updates are then used to show a general report of how the goal is progessing over time.
goals_explainer_3: 您可以隨時通過為溝通者創建目標來開始使用目標。然後使用筆記和評估來跟踪隨著時間的推移實現目標的進度。用戶可以有多個目標，但一次只能有一個“主要”目標。 [[ You can start using goals at any time by creating a goal for a communicator. Then use notes and assessments to track progress toward the goal over time. Users can have multiple goals, but only one "primary" goal at a time.
goals_explainer_4: 有關選擇好的目標的更多信息，請查看這些很棒的資源 來自 PrAACtical AAC。 [[ For more information on choosing good goals, please check out these great resources from PrAACtical AAC.

lapsed_consider_subscribing: 感謝您購買%app_name%！您當前沒有有效訂閱。不用擔心，您仍然可以將 %app_name% 用作強大的基於雲的通信系統，但您的帳戶目前已禁用雲附加功能。如果您需要這些功能，請考慮購買持續訂閱。 [[ Thank you for purchasing %app_name%! Don't worry, you can still use %app_name% as a robust, cloud-based communication system, but the cloud extras are currently disabled for your account. If you need those features please consider purchasing an ongoing subscription.
premium_supporter_consider_purchasing: 您已註冊主管帳戶。感謝您支持使用 %app_name% 的傳播者！此帳戶設置為支持帳戶，因此某些功能僅在您連接到付費通訊器時才能使用。如果您打算將此用作通信帳戶，則應購買完整的通信器帳戶。 [[ You are signed up for a supervisor account. Thank you for supporting communicators using %app_name%! This account is set as a support account, so some features will only work if you are connected to a paid communicator. If you plan to use this as a communication account you should purchase a full communicator account instead.
eval_auto_resets: 此帳戶已註冊為評估者帳戶。感謝您支持使用 %app_name% 的傳播者！此帳戶是評估者帳戶，因此可以完全訪問通信功能，但會在每次評估結束時自動重置。您可以從用戶帳戶頁面上的“附加”菜單管理評估設置。 [[ This account is registered as an evaluator account. Thank you for supporting communicators using %app_name%! This account is an evaluator account, so it has full access to communication features, but will auto-reset at the end of each evaluation. You can manage eval settings from the "Extras" menu on the user account page.
modeling_only_consider_purchasing: 這是一個僅限建模的帳戶。這種類型的帳戶可以用來支持鏈接的傳播者！您可以下載交流者的板來練習、學習並向他們展示他們可以自己嘗試的示例。如果您還想訪問用戶報告、目標和編輯訪問權限，您應該購買高級支持者訪問權限。 [[ This is a modeling-only account. This type of account can be used to support linked communicators! You can download a communicator's boards to practice, learn, and show them examples they can try on their own. If you would also like access to user reports, goals, and edit access, you should purchase premium supporter access.
subscription_expired: 您的高級帳戶已過期。請選擇一個新的計費選項。 [[ Your premium account has expired. Please select a new billing option.
currently_premium: 感謝您購買%app_name%！此帳戶啟用了雲額外功能並且功能齊全。我們希望 %app_name% 適合您！ [[ Thank you for purchasing %app_name%! This account has cloud extra features enabled and is fully functional. We hope %app_name% is working well for you!
expired_but_only_as_communicator: 您使用高級支持者帳戶購買了%app_name%，但目前已將其設置為傳播者角色。因此，此帳戶中的某些功能將受到限制。您可以切換回支持者角色以刪除此通知。如果您想完全解鎖傳播者角色，請購買 %app_name% 的完整許可證。 [[ You purchased %app_name% using a premium supporter account, but have currently set it as a communicator role. As such, some features will be limited in this account. You can switch back to a supporter role to remove this notice. If you would like to fully unlock the communicator role, please purchase a full license of %app_name%.
premium_symbols_enabled: 您的帳戶還可以訪問高級符號，因此您可以搜索 SymbolStix 或 Tobii Dynavox 的 PCS (BoardMaker) 中的其他符號並將其包含在您的板上。 [[ Your account also has access to premium symbols, so you can search through and include additional symbols from SymbolStix, or PCS (BoardMaker) by Tobii Dynavox in your boards.

premium_symbols_explainer_1: %app_name% 的默認符號庫是一組很棒的、開放許可的圖像，可以公開共享並用於許多不同的項目。但是，有時您可能需要一個特定的符號庫，而傳播者已經使用了更長的時間。 [[ %app_name%'s default symbol libraries are a collection of great, open-licensed images that can be shared publicly and used on lots of different projects. However, sometimes you may need a specific symbol library that communicators have been using longer.
premium_symbols_explainer_2: 如果是這種情況，您可以通過一次性支付 25 美元的費用從 SymbolStix 或 Tobii Dynavox 的 PCS (BoardMaker) 購買額外高級符號的訪問權限，以授予對這些符號的訪問權限。 [[ If that's the case, you can purchase access to additional premium symbols from SymbolStix, or PCS (BoardMaker) by Tobii Dynavox by paying a one-time $25 fee to grant access to these symbols.

If you sign up for a monthly account we won't start charging for 2 months, and a long-term purchase will still get your 2 free months as well, so feel free to sign up now!

purchase_subscription_1g: %app_name% 是一款功能強大、靈活的交流工具，具有許多出色的功能。某些功能（包括此功能）僅適用於購買了高級帳戶的用戶。請 [[ %app_name% is a powerful, flexible communication tool with lots of great features. Some features, including this one, are only available to users who have purchased a premium account. Please

badges_explainer: 這位通訊員獲得了一個或多個徽章！ %app_name% 中會自動設置一些徽章，但您也可以輕鬆設置自己的目標並分配新的徽章以配合它們。 [[ This communicator had earned one or more badges! Some badges are automatically set up in %app_name%, but you can also easily set your own goals and assign new badges to go with them.
goals_explainer: 設定目標是溝通過程的重要組成部分！在 %app_name% 中，目標可以幫助團隊保持在同一頁面上並致力於同一件事，這對於新開發的溝通者來說很重要。 [[ Setting goals is an important part of the communication process! In %app_name%, goals can help keep the team on the same page and working on the same thing, which is important for newly-developing communicators.
goals_explainer_12: 如果您退出說話模式並轉到帳戶的“目標”部分，您可以找到現有目標或設置自己的目標。您甚至可以讓系統自動跟踪目標的進度，並在溝通者取得進展時獎勵徽章！ [[ If you exit Speak Mode and go to the 'Goals' section of your account you can find an existing goal or set one of your own. You can even have the system automatically track progress toward the goal, and award badges to the communicator as they progress!
goals_explainer_2: 要設置您的第一個目標，請點擊下方的“新目標”按鈕並開始。你可以找到一個現有的目標或設定一個你自己的目標。您甚至可以讓系統自動跟踪目標的進度，並在溝通者取得進展時獎勵徽章！ [[ To set your first goal, hit the 'New Goal' button below and get started. You can find an existing goal or set one of your own. You can even have the system automatically track progress toward the goal, and award badges to the communicator as they progress!

error_installing_tool: 安裝工具時出錯 [[ Error Installing Tool
please_check_settings: 請檢查您是否輸入了正確的設置 [[ Please check that you have entered the correct settings
credentials_already_in_use: 看起來這些設置已被其他 %app_name% 用戶使用 [[ It looks like those settings are already being used by a different %app_name% user
bad_webhook_url: 您輸入的 URL 似乎與此集成所需的值不匹配 [[ The URL you entered doesn't seem to match the value needed for this integration
some_hard_to_hear: 有些人很難聽 [[ Some people are hard to hear
want_to_fix_that: ——不是因為他們自己的過錯。許多人需要技術的幫助才能讓他們的聲音被聽到。不幸的是，很多這種技術很難使用，很難配置，而且非常昂貴。 %app_name% 是一個新的 AAC 應用程序，它試圖解決這個問題。 [[ -- through no fault of their own. Many people need the assistance of technology in order for their voices to be heard. Unfortunately, a lot of that technology is hard to use, is hard to configure, and is crazy expensive. %app_name% is a new AAC app that tries to fix that.
why_cough_drop: 為什麼是“%app_name%”？止咳藥水可以幫助你恢復你已經擁有的聲音，但也許人們聽得不太清楚。它們很便宜，當你使用它們時，沒有人會奇怪地看著你。我們希望通過為日常使用的複雜通信需求提供經濟實惠、平易近人、簡單的解決方案來幫助 AAC 達到同樣的目標。 [[ Why "%app_name%"? Cough drops help you get back the voice you already had, but that maybe people couldn't hear so well. They're cheap and nobody looks at you weird when you use them. We want to help get AAC to that same point by providing affordable, approachable, simple solutions to complex communication needs that work for everyday use.
learn_as_you_go: 邊走邊學 [[ Learn as You Go
learn_as_you_go_content_1: 如果您不熟悉增強通信的世界，那麼它的幾乎每個部分都會讓人感到恐懼。您怎麼可能知道為個人的個人需求（以及想要、希望和願望）選擇正確的詞語和符號。不用擔心，我們與許多不同的專家合作，提供經過充分研究的模板，幫助您入門。同樣重要的是，我們為父母、看護人、兄弟姐妹提供培訓資源……參與支持個人的每個人都應該知道發生了什麼，以及他們究竟如何幫助溝通策略取得成功。 [[ If you're new to the world of augmentative communication, just about every part of it feels intimidating. How could you possibly know the right words and symbols to pick for an individual's personal needs (and wants, and hopes, and wishes). Not to worry, we work with many different specialists to provide well-researched templates that will get you started. And just as importantly, we provide training resources for parents, caregivers, siblings... everyone involved in supporting an individual deserves to know what's going on and how exactly they can help the communication strategies be successful.
offline_content_1: 收集數據和跨設備工作非常棒，但仍有很多地方沒有良好的 Wi-Fi 連接。 %app_name% 存儲用戶的板子並在每個設備上登錄，以便用戶可以無中斷地離線通信。下次有互聯網連接時，所有內容都會同步備份。 [[ Gathering data and working across devices is great, but there are still plenty of places where you won't have a good Wi-fi connection. %app_name% stores a user's boards and logs on each device so the user can communicate offline with no interrupts. Everything syncs back up the next time there is an internet connection.
personalization: 個性化和同步 [[ Personalization and Sync
personalization_content_1: 綁定到單個設備是有風險的，尤其是當您添加了許多自己的圖片或移動圖片符號以供個人使用時。您不僅可能會丟失數據和配置，而且如果屏幕破裂或電池沒電了，在更換之前您會很不走運。 %app_name% 可跨多個設備工作，並為您保持內容同步，因此您不必擔心。 [[ Being tied to a single device is risky, especially when you've added lots of your own pictures or moved picture symbols around for personal use. Not only can you possibly lose your data and configuration, but if a screen cracks or a battery dies, you're out of luck until it can be replaced. %app_name% works across multiple devices and keeps content in sync for you so you don't have to worry.
create_share: 創建、共享和重用 [[ Create, Share and Reuse
create_share_content_1: 在創建一組通信板時，沒有人願意從頭開始。 %app_name% 讓您輕鬆發現和個性化他人創建的通訊板。並且 %app_name% 鼓勵內容和符號的開放許可，因此您不必懷疑您是否在某處意外侵犯了版權。 [[ Nobody wants to start from scratch when creating a set of communication boards. %app_name% lets you easily discover and personalize communication boards created by others. And %app_name% encourages open licenses of content and symbols, so you don't have to wonder if you're breaking copyright somewhere on accident.
open_board_support: %app_name% 致力於使板子開放和可重複使用。以至於我們開始了OpenBoards 倡議，致力於為所有應用和設備導入和導出板的標准文件格式，我們使用該格式作為我們的本機導入/導出格式。當我們可以自由地建立彼此的想法和成功，無論他們來自哪裡，每個人都會贏。 [[ %app_name% is committed to making boards open and reusable. So much so that we started the OpenBoards initiative to work toward a standard file format for importing and exporting boards across all apps and devices, and we use that format as our native import/export format. When we have the freedom to build off of each other's ideas and successes regardless of where they came from, everyone wins.
coordination_content_1: 必須將個人的通信設備從他們身邊拿走才能對其進行編程是一件可怕的事情，它會奪走他們的聲音。 %app_name% 讓治療師、專家、父母和其他團隊成員修改通信集，甚至在每個人都可以從中受益的地方記錄會話筆記和消息。 [[ Having to take an individual's communication device away from them in order to program it is a terrible thing, it takes away their voice. %app_name% lets therapists, specialists, parents and other team members modify the communication set and even log session notes and messages in a place where everyone can benefit from them.
insights_content_1: 有時真的很難知道什麼有效，什麼無效。增強交流是一個不斷修改和引入詞彙的過程，如果沒有好的報告，很難確定需要改變什麼。 %app_name% 可以記錄所有通信，並根據時間、地點和詞彙提供有見地的報告，讓每個人都更清楚地知道他們應該在哪裡集中精力以獲得最佳結果。 [[ Sometimes it's really hard to know what's working and what's not. Augmentative communication is an ongoing process of modifying and introducing vocabulary, and without good reports it's difficult to be sure what needs to change. %app_name% can log all communications and provide insightful reports based on time, location and vocabulary that makes it clearer for everyone just where to focus their efforts for the best results.
security_content_1: %app_name% 提供所有板、日誌和用戶信息的安全通信和存儲。未經明確許可，我們不會共享用戶數據、私人版塊和使用日誌等私人信息。我們非常重視用戶隱私，因為歸根結底，我們所說的可能是記錄個人所說的一切。這類信息值得保護。 [[ %app_name% provides secure communication and storage of all boards, logs and user information. We do not share private information like user data, private boards and usage logs without explicit permission. We take user privacy extremely seriously because, at the end of the day, what we're talking about is potentially recording everything an individual ever says. That kind of information deserves to be protected.
open_source_content_1: 大多數 AAC 系統都建立在專有技術之上，這意味著您並不真正了解它們的安全性，更容易被鎖定並被迫採用它們的做事方式。 CoughDrop 是開源的並以開放的心態構建，因此您可以親眼看到系統中的內容，並且您始終可以輕鬆訪問和導出所有數據。 [[ Most AAC systems are built on proprietary technology, which means you don't really know how secure they are, it's easier to get locked in and forced into their way of doing things. CoughDrop is open source and built with an open mindset, so you can see for yourself what goes into the system, and you always have easy access and exports for all your data.
welcome_with_steps: 歡迎來到%app_name%！您應該很快會在收件箱中收到一封確認電子郵件。同時，這裡有一些簡單的後續步驟。您可以隨時從儀表板返回此列表，只需點擊右上角的徽標，然後再次打開此列表。 [[ Welcome to %app_name%! You should get a confirmation email in your inbox soon. In the mean time here's some easy next steps. You can get back to this list anytime from the dashboard, just hit the logo in the top corner then open this list again.
intro_explanation: 了解一些關於 %app_name% 是什麼以及它是如何工作的基礎知識。 [[ Pick up some basics about what %app_name% is and how it works.

home_board_explanation: 當你想說話時，你的主頁是你默認去的地方。 [[ Your home board is where you'll go by default when you want to speak.

preferences_explanation: 自定義 %app_name% 的外觀、打開日誌記錄等。 [[ Customize how %app_name% looks, turn on logging, etc.
update_your_profile: 更新您的個人資料 [[ Update your profile
profile_explanation: 檢查您的姓名、電子郵件、通知和基本簡歷。 [[ Check your name, email, notifications, and basic bio.
pick_subscription: 設置訂閱 [[ Set up a subscription
subscription_explanation: 購買 %app_name% 以在您的免費預覽結束後繼續使用它。 [[ Purchase %app_name% to keep using it after your free preview has ended.
skip_setup: 我完成了這份清單 [[ I'm Done with this Checklist
generating_log: 正在生成用於下載的日誌文件... [[ Generating log file for download...
error_downloading_log: 下載日誌文件時出錯 [[ There was an error download the log file
confirm_user_log_download: %app_name% 將生成一個包含%{un} 日誌的完整歷史記錄 的文件作為打開板日誌文件< /a> 您可以下載並與您的團隊共享或上傳到另一個系統。如果您已經使用 %app_name% 很長時間了，那麼這可能需要一段時間。你想繼續嗎？ [[ %app_name% will generate a file containing a full history of the %{un}'s logs as an open board log file which you can download and share with your team or upload into another system. If you have been using %app_name% for a long time then this could take a while. Would you like to continue?

alert_user: 向通訊器發送有關此消息的警報 [[ Send an alert the communicator about this message
